alert.note: Alert for Coke; Nolan; Sterling; Tom Green (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 23 at 5:23PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Coke, Sterling, southwestern Nolan and northwestern Tom Green Counties through 615 PM CDT... At 523 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 10 miles southwest of Sterling City, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sterling City, Silver, Broome, E.V. Spence Reservoir Near Paint Creek Recreation Area, Water Valley, The Intersection Of Highway 158 And Ranch Road 2059 and Us-87 Near The Coke-Tom Green County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
